data.name: Whitcomb Rye
data.description: Brewed with 40% Rye Malt and a delicate hop portfolio, this ale offers the drinker a crisp, evident rye flavor. Not a hoppy American Rye-PA profile — in Whitcomb Rye, the spicy grain prevails over its company of hops.

style.name: Rye Ale or Lager with or without Yeast
style.description: Rye beers can be made using either ale or lager yeast. It should be brewed with at least 20 percent rye malt, and low to medium perception of hop bitterness. Hop aroma and flavor can be low to medium-high. These are often versions of classic styles that contain noticeable rye character in balance with other qualities of the beer. A spicy, fruity-estery aroma and flavor are typical but at low levels; however, phenolic, clove-like characteristics should not be perceived. Color is straw to amber, and the body should be light to medium in character. Diacetyl should not be perceived. If this style is packaged and served without yeast, no yeast characters should be evident in mouthfeel, flavor, or aroma. A low level of tannin derived astringency may be perceived. If this style is served with yeast, the character should portray a full yeasty mouthfeel and appear hazy to very cloudy. Yeast flavor and aroma should be low to medium but not overpowering the balance and character of rye and barley malt and hops. Darker versions of this style will be dark amber to dark brown, and the body should be light to medium in character. Roasted malts are optionally evident in aroma and flavor with a low level of roast malt astringency acceptable when appropriately balanced with malt sweetness. Roast malts may be evident as a cocoa/chocolate or caramel character. Aromatic toffee-like, caramel, or biscuit-like characters may be part of the overall flavor/aroma profile. As in the lighter colored versions, diacetyl should not be perceived. Competition directors may create specific styles of rye beer, such as Rye Pale Ale or Rye Brown Ale. A statement by the brewer indicating if the beer is based on a classic style is essential for accurate judging.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

data.name: Wild & Crazy Rye IPA
data.description: Brewed with strong American hops to give this IPA it’s flavor & aroma that bursts out of your glass to dance on your tastebuds.  With the addition of 20% malted rye, you’ll feel a slight spicy tingle on your tongue which balances quite well with the hop presence in this extremely well crafted Rye India Pale Ale.

data.name: Wiley Wolverine Rye Pale Ale
data.description: This American-style pale ale has generous amounts of rye malt added to spice up the flavor profile. Centennial hops exclusively provide firm bitterness and a full hop flavor and aroma.

breweries.name: Weasel Boy Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded by Jay and Lori Wince in 2006 Weasel Boy Brewing Company began brewing operations in July of 2007. The brewpub brews mostly traditional style ales specializing in well balanced session strength offerings. 
Winners of GABF medals in both 2010 (bronze) and 2012 (gold) for their Anastasia Russian Imperial Stout, Weasel Boy is well recognized for brewing high quality products. 
The brewpub offers artisan pizza made with fresh local ingredients, supports local art and music, and regularly participates in community events benefiting local causes.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Tuesday through Friday  4pm to Midnight 
Saturday 3pm to Midnight

data.name: Witicus
data.description: While it is difficult to make something so good twice as good, the brewers at Freetail have found a way. Brewed with Franco-Belge Pils Malt, Fawcett Malted Rye and raw wheat this big, Amer-Belgo-style ale is a far cry from its little brother. Bursting with fruit esters of pear, pineapple and citrus from our favorite yeast strain, Witicus merits comparison with the oft-requested Threetail and hints at the power of Super Saison. Still, Witicus stands alone as a unique beer—look for spiced versions to appear on tap through the end of our long summer.

breweries.name: Freetail Brewing Company
breweries.description:
#1 rated brewpub in Texas (rated by BeerAdvocate.com) located at NW Military Highway and Loop 1604. Winner of the San Antonio Express-News 2009 Critics Choice and 2010 Silver Medalist for "Best Place for a Cold Beer" & San Antonio Magazine's Best of the City "Best Place for a Beer" for two years running (2009, 2010).  Winner of Draft Magazine "Top 25 Beers of 2010" in the smoked beer category for "Rubio Fumando".

Named after the official Texas flying mammal, the Mexican Free-tail Bat, Freetail opened its doors Thanksgiving Weekend 2008 and has been cranking out highly rated, fresh, off-the-wall brews ever since.

We feature fresh craft brews from in house and around the state of Texas in addition to artisan pizzas, sandwiches, salads, appetizers and desserts made from the highest quality ingredients.

Join the friendliest staff in town for happy hour M 4-7 andW-F 3-7 with $5 apps and $1 off beer and wine!  Or try us on Tuesdays for Pint Night where Freetail pints are $2.50 all day, or Mondays for $10 pitchers.  Enjoy Freetail brews and guest beer from microbreweries around the state in our spacious open seating, or large outdoor patio with bar service, and catch the game on one of our nine high-definition TV's and two 100"+ screens.free_wi_fi_spot_copy.gif  Free WiFi for customers.

breweries.name: Oliphant Brewing
breweries.description:
we're pretty sure that the beer made was part ectoplasmic mud intended as a 5th dimensional chrysalis for an almost immediate and rude awakening of shrimp-kind. once fed to the prawny bastards they grow strong and stout. they're tenuous ligament connections calcify and grow stronger and they can appear to read people's minds by a simple flexing of their delicious muscles. they're tv antenna antennas probe the air and gently wave in the breeze though the touch them is as touching rough-grit sand and glass paper and leaves tiny shards similar grabbing the white paint of a fire hydrant marker. 

we had no idea. we swear. 

we're just here's to brew beer, not help with the awakening of the earth's 6th cycle of developed beings. that being said -- all hail the prawn people! may their mighty and lesser claws be bound only by their own strength of will. let the buddha shrimp click and clackle their obscene language to the world.

data.name: Wry Wolf 2.0
data.description: Rye Bock w/unique fermentation (both lager and ale yeast). Orange/amber in color, slight fruit/rye nose with a strong malt character and slight bitter finish.

breweries.name: Wild Wolf Brewing Co
breweries.description: Located in Nelson County, Wild Wolf Brewing Co is an award winning brewery and farm to fork restaurant situated on 10 acres featuring gorgeous mountain views, a Biergarten with waterfalls, and a hop yard where chickens and ducks do the weeding/fertilizing. Enjoy corn hole, big screen TVs and live music. Dog/kid friendly.

data.name: Wye Rye
data.description: Nomed after the ever-resilient Wye Oak in Maryland, the ale you have chosen here is made of one of the most robust grains known to man, this Rye Ale, unlikke most others, has a subtle spice and a sweet caramel finish. Inspired by a well-balanced pale ale, it will beg you to ask the question, "Wye Not?" Calvert pride and farm grown ingredients in every bottle

breweries.name: Calvert Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The name Calvert has a rich tradition of pride, loyalty, and long standing quality in the State of Maryland. Calvert County has a history of rich farmlands which produces all the valuable crops that were exported throughout Maryland and up and down the bountiful Chesapeake Bay. 

There is a certain pride that comes from Calvert County families, who can be traced back to some of the earliest settlement days. Calvert Brewing Company was originated on one of these farms.

A working farm where we grow several varietals of hops, a farm brewery and vibrant vineyard/beer garden providing fun, entertainment, and the freshest beer to the local area residents in Calvert County and those willing to travel a short distance from the DC/Baltimore metro area. Closer to the metro area is our production facility and taproom which is situated in Upper Marlboro right off Route 301 on Commerce Court and will be open soon to the craft community.

Calvert Brewing Company’s goal is not to be a another craft beer, but to build a better beer with fresh ideas and ingredients day in and day out. 

Our brewery features the unique ability of Mash Filtration. This process presses the mash yielding the most wort possible out of each batch while using 30% less water and brewing at 95% efficiency all due to the state of the art IDD system. Consistency is key.

Fresh from the farm to your palate, you can taste our vision and see the liquid sermon that is Calvert Brewing Company.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: SoMe Brewing Company
breweries.description: Small upstart looking to offer solid tasty local beer. We will focus on improving standard styles by using the best ingredients and taking the time to craft a beer that truly is better, and not just good. No frills. No "clever new ingredients!" Just solid tasty local beer.
